overview.layersSubtitle: Each slice owns a single responsibility so swapping repositories or transports never touches business rules.

layers.title: Entities & validation
layers.description: Protects invariants for Product, User, Address, OTP, and Order before persistence ever runs.

layers.title: Storage adapters
layers.description: Thread-safe in-memory stores today, database adapters tomorrow—both implement the same contracts.

layers.title: Use cases
layers.description: Business orchestration for onboarding, OTP login, address/default rules, stock reservation, and totals.

layers.title: Gin handlers & router
layers.description: HTTP binding, middleware, and normalized responses for /api/v1 plus /health liveness checks.

overview.workflowSubtitle: Map every POST/GET to the human story behind it.

workflowSteps.title: Signup
workflowSteps.description: POST /api/v1/users seeds a customer, hashes the password, and emits an activation OTP to stdout.

workflowSteps.title: Activation
workflowSteps.description: POST /api/v1/auth/activate toggles is_active once the mobile + OTP pair is validated.

workflowSteps.title: Two-step login
workflowSteps.description: POST /api/v1/auth/login validates the stored password, then /verify issues a signed session cookie after OTP verification.

workflowSteps.title: Transact
workflowSteps.description: Authenticated shoppers list products, attach saved addresses, and submit orders with one JSON payload.

overview.apiSubtitle: These routes are pre-configured in the playground so you can test them instantly.

status.title: Runtime health

users.title: Customer lifecycle
users.subtitle: Match every screen in the auth UI with the real endpoints backing it.

steps.title: Register
steps.description: POST /api/v1/users with name, email, mobile, and password.

steps.title: Activate
steps.description: Copy the OTP from backend logs and POST /api/v1/auth/activate.

steps.title: Login
steps.description: OTP login requires two POST calls (/login then /verify).

users.createDescription: Mirrors the Register form in the UI.
users.activateDescription: Activates the mobile number once the OTP matches.
users.adminDescription: GET /api/v1/users, fetch other profiles, or delete users require the `admin` role set in the database.

authFlows.title: OTP-first authentication
authFlows.subtitle: All mutations live behind explicit POST calls so you can trace audit logs easily.
notes: Login is stateless until the verify step sets the signed cookie.
Session cookies include the user id and role to accelerate authorization.
Password resets reuse the OTP repository with the `reset` purpose.

loginSection.title: Two-step login
loginSection.subtitle: Step one checks the password, step two verifies the OTP.
loginSection.initiateDescription: Sends a fresh OTP. Response status is 202 Accepted.
loginSection.verifyDescription: On success the backend sets an HTTP-only cookie.

resetSection.title: Password reset
resetSection.subtitle: Two calls: request the OTP, then submit the new password.
resetSection.forgotDescription: Matches email + mobile and logs an OTP.
resetSection.resetDescription: Requires the OTP plus matching identifiers.

addresses.title: Reusable shipping profiles
addresses.subtitle: Address handlers clone the payload into each order so edits never mutate history.
highlights: Authenticated endpoints only—cookies route to the correct owner automatically.
Default selection is enforced server-side. Only one default at a time.
addresses.createDescription: POST /api/v1/addresses to create or update the default in one call.
addresses.listDescription: Returns every saved address for the authenticated user.

orders.title: Order orchestration
orders.subtitle: Requests clone the selected address, lock inventory, and calculate totals atomically.
requirements: Authenticated session (customer orders their own id, admins can impersonate).
At least one valid product id + quantity.
Either `address_id` that belongs to the user or an inline shipping payload.
orders.createDescription: Include the user id plus either address_id or inline `shipping_address`.
orders.listDescription: Admins see everyone. Customers see their own.
orders.detailDescription: GET /api/v1/orders/:id returns items, totals, and the cloned address.
orders.adminDescription: Admins can query orders per user id.
